note.p: Birth: St-Julien, near Villefranche, Beaujolais, France (12 July 1813)

Career: Worked in an apothecary's shop; went to Paris and took up medicine (1834); Assistant to the physiologist Magendie, College de France (1841); Professor of Physiology (1855); discovered the functions of the pancreas
References: Claude Debru, 'On the Usefulness of the History of Science for Scientific Education' in NR 1997 vol 51 pp 291-307, plate
Sir Ashley Miles, 'Reports by Louis Pasteur and Claude Bernard on the Organization of Scientific Teaching and Research' in NR 1982-83 vol 37 pp 101-118
